problems.yes: You have provided your README file and your implementation is accessible.
problems.no: You did not provide a README file and/but your implementation is not accessible.

problems.yes: You have provided a READ ONLY link to Overleaf for your project report.
problems.no: You did not provide a READ ONLY link to Overleaf for your project report.

problems.yes: You have provided the exact commit hash for your GitHub.
problems.no: You did not provide commit hash for your GitHub for us to consider. Please make sure to add your GitHub commit hash for your upcoming assignments.

problems.yes: You have used proper reference style in your report.
problems.no: You did not follow the proper reference style for your report. You could have consistently follow either APA, MLA or IEEE reference style.

problems.yes: Your graphs/figures are readable. Good job!
problems.no: Your figures/graphs are not readable, it requires us to zoom while we are trying to read the graphs/figures.

problems.yes: Great job! Your report met the page limit requirement. Keep up the concise and focused writing.
problems.no: Your report exceeded the 8-page limit. For future reports, please aim to keep it within the required length by focusing on key points and being concise.

problems.yes: You clearly stated an explicit hypothesis, helping to establish a focused narrative for the report. Your approach ensures clarity and direction, making the analysis more structured and purposeful.
problems.no: You needed to explain how you decided about your hypotheses. In other words, how did you come to derive your hypotheses?

problems.yes: You build your hypothesis using evidence.
problems.no: Your hypothesis is not grounded by evidence. You should have provided explicit evidence and ground your hypothesis around those.

problems.yes: You followed up with the hypothesis in your discussion/conclusion.
problems.no: You cannot just state a hypothesis since it needs to follow through from a narrative perspective at the end of your report.

problems.yes: You have provided direct evidence to support whether your hypothesis has been met.
problems.no: You didn't provide direct evidence to support whether your hypothesis has been met.

problems.yes: You successfully explained how RHC performs relative to problem characteristics and addressed how it handles local optima. Your analysis demonstrates a clear understanding of the topic.
problems.no: Your report did not fully explain how RHC performs relative to problem characteristics or how it handles local optima. In future work, please provide a more detailed discussion on these aspects to meet the requirement.

problems.yes: You effectively presented a plot/table of RHC performance over iterations and provided a clear explanation of the observed trends. Your analysis enhances the understanding of RHC's behavior.
problems.no: Your report is missing a plot or table of RHC performance over iterations and/or an explanation of observed trends. Please include these elements in future reports to fully meet the requirement.

problems.yes: You successfully presented a plot/table comparing RHC performance at different problem sizes. The comparison is clear and provides valuable insights into how problem size impacts performance.
problems.no: Your report is missing a plot or table comparing RHC performance at different problem sizes. Please include this in future reports to provide a complete analysis of how problem size affects performance.
